intro: Corispermum laxiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered corisperm, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically narrow and succulent. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The seeds are encased in a hard, dry fruit, which is characteristic of the Caryophyllales order.
